item.title: US Fed Meeting LIVE: Wall Street drifts higher ahead of Powell-led FOMC's final interest rate verdict for 2024 | Mint - Mint
item.description:
US Fed Meeting LIVE: Wall Street drifts higher ahead of Powell-led FOMC's final interest rate verdict for 2024

Date: 18 Dec 2024

Source: LiveMint

The US Federal Reserve is set to announce its final policy decision for 2024, with expectations of a 25 basis points rate cut following a two-day meeting. Wall Street braces for impacts on the economy and market stability amidst ongoing shifts in U.S. economic strategy.

  • Jerome Powell leads the FOMC, which is expected to reduce the benchmark rate for the second consecutive time.
  • The last policy decision came after a significant political shift with the election of Donald Trump.
  • The Fed has already reduced rates by 50 basis points in previous meetings.
  • The market predicts further cuts in 2025 as inflation trends are closely monitored.
“If the data allow us to proceed a bit more gradually, that seems to be the prudent course of action,” said Powell.

In conclusion, the Federal Reserve's upcoming decision is crucial as it reflects broader economic trends and influences market conditions into the following year.

item.title: Airlines oppose proposal on reduced night flying for pilots - The Hindu
item.description:
Airlines oppose proposal on reduced night flying for pilots

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: The Hindu

IndiGo and Air India Group have opposed the DGCA’s proposal to extend the definition of night flying, citing operational impacts and the need for an advanced fatigue management system. Airlines are also resisting changes to weekly rest periods for pilots.

  • IndiGo rejected the proposal to raise the night flying definition to include 6 a.m.
  • Air India argues they need a fatigue management system before implementing changes.
  • Airlines delayed responses on proposed rest periods for pilots.
  • Proposals include the restriction of landings during night flying.
  • Aviation expert highlights the health implications of night flying on pilots.
“The body repairs itself during a period of 2 a.m. to 5 a.m. when a person is sleeping. But if the person is awake that repair is not happening, since it disturbs the circadian rhythm.” - Captain Amit Singh

The opposition from airlines raises concerns about pilot fatigue and operational safety, emphasizing the need for a comprehensive fatigue management system before new regulations are enforced.

item.title: School Dropout To A Billionaire, Nikhil Kamath Shares His Entrepreneurial Journey - NDTV
item.description:
From School Dropout to Billionaire: Nikhil Kamath's Entrepreneurial Journey

Publication Date: Recent
Source: LinkedIn

Nikhil Kamath, co-founder of Zerodha, discusses his transformative journey from being a high school dropout to a successful billionaire entrepreneur during an interview with LinkedIn's CEO, Ryan Roslansky. He underscores the importance of learning from failures and his early entrepreneurial experiences.

  • Nikhil's first business venture involved selling a cellphone in the 9th grade.
  • His mother ended his initial entrepreneurial pursuits by flushing the phones down the toilet.
  • After dropping out, Kamath took on a night shift at a call center while self-teaching stock trading.
  • He managed investments for his colleagues and realized significant earnings through commissions.
  • Kamath emphasizes that learning from failures has been key to his success.
“I've learned everything I have learned only through failure. I don't think success teaches much outside of creating an ecosystem where it is easier for you to get complacent.” - Nikhil Kamath

His journey challenges conventional norms in finance, empowering individuals to take control of their financial futures.

item.title: Asian Paints Top Two Executives Resign Citing Personal Circumstances - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Asian Paints' Top Two Executives Resign Citing 'Personal Circumstances'

Date: 18 Dec 2024

Source: NDTV Profit

Asian Paints announced the resignation of its top two executives, Shyam Swamy and Vishu Goel, citing personal circumstances. The company disclosed these resignations in filings to the stock exchanges.

  • Shyam Swamy served as vice president of home improvement and décor.
  • Vishu Goel was the associate vice president of retail sales.
  • There are expectations that Asian Paints may face slower growth compared to competitors.
  • Ongoing consumption slump in urban India is likely to impact Asian Paints more than smaller players.
"Asian Paints' volume growth is expected to be dragged down to 1% year-on-year in the December quarter."

In conclusion, the resignations may impact the company's strategic direction amidst challenges in the market, highlighting ongoing pressures within the industry.

item.title: Asian Paints announces resignation of 2 top executives - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Asian Paints Announces Resignation of Two Top Executives

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

Asian Paints has announced the resignation of two senior management members, Shyam Swamy and Vishu Goel, effective December 17, 2024.

  • Shyam Swamy served as Vice President of Home Improvement, Décor, Services & Retailing.
  • Vishu Goel was the Associate Vice President of Retail Sales, Commercial & Marketing.
  • The resignations were accepted by the company on the same day, and reasons for departure were not disclosed.
  • Shares of Asian Paints Ltd ended at ₹2,345.70, down by ₹11.10, or 0.47%.
“His resignation was accepted on 17th December 2024 and he has ceased to be an employee of the Company and a member of the Senior Management.”

The resignations reflect a shift within the company's senior management, although details on their reasons for leaving remain unspecified.

item.title: Fed set to trim interest rates, signal fewer cuts in 2025 in latest dot plot - FXStreet
item.description:
Fed Expected to Slash Interest Rates, Yet Dot Plot Could Show Doubts Over Further Cuts Ahead

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: FXStreet

The US Federal Reserve is anticipated to lower the policy interest rate by 25 basis points during its last meeting of 2024. Market reactions to the Fed's decision and Chairman Powell's comments will be closely monitored for future rate expectations.

  • The Federal Reserve is widely expected to lower the policy rate by 25 bps.
  • Chairman Powell’s remarks and the revised dot plot will reveal insights into the interest-rate outlook.
  • The US Dollar may experience significant valuation impacts as the holiday season approaches.
“While we think the Fed will remain keen on projecting additional policy easing for 2025, our view is that guidance regarding the pace of rate cuts will be more cautious going forward.” - TD Securities analysts

In conclusion, investors are keenly awaiting the Fed's monetary policy announcements, with potential implications for the USD and global markets.

item.title: Foxconn has discussed making bid for Nissan | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Foxconn Explores Acquisition of Nissan to Boost EV Business

Date: Not specified   Source: Live Mint

Taiwanese manufacturer Foxconn is in discussions to acquire Nissan as part of its strategy to expand into the electric vehicle market.

  • Foxconn aims to leverage Nissan's expertise in car hardware manufacturing and design.
  • Jun Seki, a former Nissan executive, is instrumental in the negotiations.
  • This initiative aligns with Foxconn's ambition to grow its electric vehicle operations.
"Foxconn has a particular interest in the Japanese automaker’s core assets."

The potential acquisition signifies Foxconn's serious commitment to breaking into the electric vehicle industry, utilizing Nissan's established capabilities.

item.title: Best 10 IPOs of 2024 by listing day gains - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Best 10 IPOs of 2024 by Listing Day Gains

Published on Dec 18, 2024, Source: CNBC TV18

This article highlights the top 10 IPOs of 2024 based on their listing day gains, showcasing significant performances and investor interest.

  • 1. Vibhor Steel Tubes: 195.53% gain, shares closed at ₹446.25, oversubscribed 320.05 times.
  • 2. BLS E-Services: 171.11% gain, shares closed at ₹366.00, oversubscribed 162.38 times.
  • 3. Bajaj Housing Finance: 135.71% gain, shares closed at ₹165.00, total subscription was ₹4,42,340.80 crore.
  • 4. KRN Heat Exchanger: 117.63% gain, shares closed at ₹478.79, oversubscribed 213.41 times.
  • 5. Unicommerce eSolutions: 94.52% gain, shares closed at ₹210.08, oversubscribed 168.35 times.
  • 6. MobiKwik: 90% gain, shares closed at nearly double the IPO price of ₹279.
  • 7. Premier Energies: 86.64% gain, shares closed at ₹839.90, oversubscribed 75.00 times.
  • 8. Le Travenues Technology: 78.19% gain, shares closed at ₹165.72, oversubscribed 98.10 times.
  • 9. JNK India: 67.36% gain, shares closed at ₹694.55, oversubscribed 28.46 times.
  • 10. P N Gadgil Jewellers: 65.27% gain, shares closed at ₹793.30, oversubscribed 59.41 times.
  • 11. DEE Development Engineers: 65.18% gain, shares closed at ₹335.32, oversubscribed 103.03 times.

item.title: Bhavish Aggarwal's big announcement: OLA to offer 10-minute food deliveries through ONDC | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
OLA Introduces 10-Minute Food Delivery Service in Bengaluru

Published on: December 17, 2023 by CNBC TV-18

Ola has launched its new service, Ola Dash, which enables quick food delivery within 10 minutes in Bengaluru, as reported by CNBC TV-18.

  • The service utilizes the existing Ola application and covers restaurants within a 1-kilometer radius.
  • Ola Dash is seen as a response to the booming quick food delivery market, competing with services like Swiggy's Bolt and Blinkit.
  • The quick commerce landscape is evolving, with Zepto also planning similar offerings.
  • This service represents Ola's diversification strategy, which now includes electric bike taxi operations in Bengaluru.
“Ola Dash's business will be similar to Swiggy Bolt's 10-minute food delivery offering.”

This new venture aims to capture market share in the rapidly growing food service industry by offering quick, efficient deliveries.

item.title: Multibagger Stock: 176% up in 2024! Jefferies says BUY | Kotak Mahindra Bank-backed share - ET Now
item.description:
KFin Technologies Stock Soars 176% in 2024: Buy Recommendation by Jefferies

Updated: December 18, 2024 | Source: ET NOW

The stock of KFin Technologies has shown remarkable performance in 2024, with significant daily gains and a strong buy recommendation from Jefferies, suggesting more upside potential ahead.

  • KFin Technologies stocks gained around 8% recently, reaching a 52-week high of Rs 1343.65.
  • Jefferies anticipates 15-20% revenue growth for the company in the medium term.
  • The company has joined BlackRock’s 'Aladdin' provider network, enhancing efficiency with asset managers.
  • Jefferies set a target price of Rs 1,530, indicating a potential upside of approximately 25% from the current stock price.
  • KFin Tech reported an impressive 174.20% return in 2024 and 86.16% over six months.
“KFin Technologies offers a long-term opportunity,” says Jefferies.

With Kotak Mahindra Bank holding a 7.73% stake in the company, the stock is well-positioned for continued growth and investor interest, while the gains over the past year highlight its strong market performance.

item.title: 'Don't build careers, rent people': CEO's unusual advice on hiring confuses internet - Hindustan Times
item.description:
TATA Play CEO Harit Nagpal's LinkedIn advice on hiring sparked mixed reactions online with many confused by his choice of words.

Published on: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

CEOs often share advice on platforms like LinkedIn to inspire and educate budding entrepreneurs. However, Harit Nagpal's recent advice on hiring has received mixed reactions for its unusual phrasing.

  • Harit Nagpal, CEO of Tata Play, suggested managers should not focus on building long-term careers for employees but instead 'rent' them.
  • The advice aims to allow employees to bring their unique beliefs and attitudes to their roles.
  • Responses to the post varied, with some endorsing the philosophy while others criticized the term 'rent' as harsh.
  • Comments on social media highlight the tension between good intentions and poorly chosen words.
“As always, admire your provocative thinking. True, people don’t stay forever—but let’s not confuse a 'rental mindset' with treating people like 'property'.” - Vivek Gambhir, Advisor and CEO

Overall, while the core message of empowering employees resonated with some, the choice of words created significant confusion.

item.title: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal's 'stern warning' to employees: I have been going through attendance data ... - The Times of India
item.description:
Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal's Stern Warning to Employees

Publication Date: Unknown Source: Unknown

In a recent message to employees, Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal expressed concerns over attendance data and emphasized the importance of accountability among team members.

  • Aggarwal noted discrepancies in attendance records.
  • He highlighted the need for a committed workforce in achieving company goals.
  • The message aimed at motivating employees to enhance their performance.
'We need to be accountable for our commitments to drive success.'

This communication underlines Ola's focus on building a strong organizational culture and the CEO's dedication to holding employees accountable for their roles.

item.title: International Gemmological Institute IPO allotment status check online; GMP today - ET Now
item.description:
International Gemmological Institute IPO Allotment Status Check Online

Updated on December 18, 2024, by ET Now

The IGI IPO experienced significant demand, particularly from Qualified Institutional Buyers, with a total oversubscription of 33.79 times. The allotment of shares is set to be concluded today.

  • The subscription window for IGI IPO was open from December 13 to December 17, 2024.
  • Shares bid amounted to 1,978,625,565 against 5,856,0902 offered shares.
  • The IPO price band was set at Rs 397 to Rs 417 per share.
“The IGI IPO witnessed the maximum demand from Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) who made bids for 1,46,17,02,830 shares.”

The IPO is expected to debut on the Bombay Stock Exchange and the National Stock Exchange on December 20, 2024.

item.title: Rs 30 Lakh Toyota Fortuner Has Arrived! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Affordable 7-Seater Toyota Fortuner Unveiled

Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: MotorOctane

Toyota has officially previewed the Hilux Rangga, a new 7-seater SUV aimed at affordability. This model is expected to cater to the Indonesian market while providing an extended and muscular design with robust features.

  • The SUV is built on a low-cost IMV platform shared with the Hilux, Innova Crysta, and Fortuner.
  • Features include a spacious interior for 7 passengers, dual airbags, touchscreen infotainment, and rear AC vents.
  • Powertrain options comprise a 2.0-litre NA petrol and a 2.4-litre turbo diesel engine with manual and automatic gearbox options.
  • The introduction of this model indicates Toyota's efforts toward making its vehicles more accessible.
"The new Hilux Rangga SUV is currently targeted for the Indonesian market, and is unlikely to make its way to India."

The unveiling of this affordable SUV aims to broaden Toyota's reach in markets with price-sensitive consumers, highlighting their commitment to affordability while maintaining quality.
